#define ZCL_COMMAND_NO_ACK   0
 APS acknowledgement is not requested.
#define ZCL_COMMAND_ACK   1
 APS acknowledgement is requested.
#define ZCL_SERVER_CLUSTER_TYPE   0
 Server part of a cluster.
#define ZCL_CLIENT_CLUSTER_TYPE   1
 Client part of a cluster.
#define ZCL_FRAME_CONTROL_DIRECTION_CLIENT_TO_SERVER   0x00
 A command will be sent from client side to server side.
#define ZCL_FRAME_CONTROL_DIRECTION_SERVER_TO_CLIENT   0x01
 A command will be sent from server side to client side.
#define ZCL_CLUSTER_SIDE_SERVER   ZCL_FRAME_CONTROL_DIRECTION_CLIENT_TO_SERVER
 To define a cluster of a server side.
#define ZCL_CLUSTER_SIDE_CLIENT   ZCL_FRAME_CONTROL_DIRECTION_SERVER_TO_CLIENT
 To define a cluster of a client side.
#define ZCL_FRAME_CONTROL_DISABLE_DEFAULT_RESPONSE   0x01
#define ZCL_FRAME_CONTROL_ENABLE_DEFAULT_RESPONSE   0x00
#define ZCL_THERE_IS_RELEVANT_RESPONSE   0x01
#define ZCL_THERE_IS_NO_RELEVANT_RESPONSE   0x00
#define ZCL_RESPONSE_CONTROLLED_BY_PAYLOAD   0x02
#define ZCL_NETWORK_KEY_CLUSTER_SECURITY   0
#define ZCL_APPLICATION_LINK_KEY_CLUSTER_SECURITY   1
#define ZCL_READWRITE_ATTRIBUTE   0U
 Attribute can be read and written remotely.
#define ZCL_REPORTABLE_ATTRIBUTE   1U
 Attribute can be reported.
#define ZCL_READONLY_ATTRIBUTE   2U
 Attribute can not be written by remote nodes.
#define ZCL_REPORTING_CONFIGURED   4U
 Attribute is configured for reporting.
#define ZCL_ON_CHANGE_REPORT   8U
 Attribute should be reported using minimum reporting time.
#define ZCL_BOUNDARY_CHECK   16U
 Attribute whose value needs to be checked for boundary check.
#define ZCL_CHECK_OTHER_ATTR   32U
 Attrbute vlue boundary check with other attribute value.
#define ZCL_DEFAULT_CLUSTER_SECURITY   ZCL_NETWORK_KEY_CLUSTER_SECURITY

 Clusters IDs' definitions. The list comprises all clusters supported in Microchip Zigbee. More...

Detailed Description

The header file defines macros used to describe ZCL clusters.

The file contains definitions of some macro functions, constants and types used to define ZCL clusters. It also includes an enumeration of IDs of all clusters supported by Microchip Zigbee.

Author:
Microchip Corporation: http://www.microchip.com
Support email: support@microchip.com

Copyright (c) 2018, Microchip Corporation. All rights reserved. Licensed under Mirochip's Limited License Agreement.

Definition in file clusters.h.

Define Documentation

#define DEFINE_ATTRIBUTE (   name,
  props,
  aid,
  atype 
)    .name = {.id = aid, .type = atype, .properties = props}

Used as means of contraction to fill the field corresponding to an attribute in the attributes structure instance of a cluster.

The macro function is used in clusters' definition files. Attributes structure contains one field for each attribute of a cluster. Attribute fields are themselves structure with the same fields. Reportable attribute have more fields.

Definition at line 41 of file clusters.h.

#define DEFINE_ATTRIBUTE_WITH_BOUNDARY (   name,
  props,
  aid,
  atype,
  minValue,
  maxValue 
)    .name = {.id = aid, .type = atype, .properties = ZCL_BOUNDARY_CHECK | props, .minVal = minValue, .maxVal = maxValue}

Used as means of contraction to fill the field corresponding to an attribute in the attributes structure instance of a cluster.

The macro function is used in clusters' definition files. Attributes structure contains one field for each attribute of a cluster. Attribute fields are themselves structure with the same fields. Attribute with boundary check and reportable have more fields.

Definition at line 52 of file clusters.h.

#define DEFINE_REPORTABLE_ATTRIBUTE (   name,
  props,
  aid,
  atype,
  minReport,
  maxReport 
)    .name = {.id = aid, .type = atype, .properties = ZCL_REPORTABLE_ATTRIBUTE | (props), .minReportInterval = minReport, .maxReportInterval = maxReport}

Used as means of contraction to fill the attribute field of the reportable attribute with a given name in the attributes structure instance of a cluster.

A reportable attribute (one that can be configured for automatical reporting) includes additional fields - min and max reporting intervals.

Definition at line 62 of file clusters.h.

#define DEFINE_REPORTABLE_ATTRIBUTE_WITH_BOUNDARY (   name,
  props,
  aid,
  atype,
  minReport,
  maxReport,
  minValue,
  maxValue 
)    .name = {.id = aid, .type = atype, .properties = ZCL_BOUNDARY_CHECK | ZCL_REPORTABLE_ATTRIBUTE | (props), .minReportInterval = minReport, .maxReportInterval = maxReport, .minVal = minValue, .maxVal = maxValue}

Used as means of contraction to fill the attribute field of the reportable attribute with a given name in the attributes structure instance of a cluster.

A reportable attribute (one that can be configured for automatical reporting) includes additional fields - min and max reporting intervals.

Definition at line 72 of file clusters.h.

#define COMMAND_OPTIONS (   cldirection,
  clwaitingResponse,
  clackRequest 
)
Value:
{.direction = ZCL_FRAME_CONTROL_DIRECTION_##cldirection, .waitingResponse = clwaitingResponse, \
   .ackRequest = clackRequest}

Used as means of contraction to fill command's option when defining a cluster's command.

The macro function is used in clusters' definition files with the DEFINE_COMMAND() macro, which itself is used to form the macro function defining all cluster's commands at once.

Definition at line 82 of file clusters.h.

#define DEFINE_COMMAND (   cname,
  cid,
  coptions,
  cind 
)    .cname = {.id = cid, .options = coptions, cind}

Used as means of contraction to fill the field corresponding to a command in the commands structure instance of a cluster.

A commands structure consists of fields, one per each command supported by the cluster.

Definition at line 91 of file clusters.h.

#define ZCL_FRAME_CONTROL_DISABLE_DEFAULT_RESPONSE   0x01

A value to disable default response for a cluster's command

Definition at line 134 of file clusters.h.

#define ZCL_FRAME_CONTROL_ENABLE_DEFAULT_RESPONSE   0x00

A value to enable default response for a cluster's command

Definition at line 136 of file clusters.h.

#define ZCL_THERE_IS_RELEVANT_RESPONSE   0x01

A relevant response command exists for this command

Definition at line 139 of file clusters.h.

#define ZCL_THERE_IS_NO_RELEVANT_RESPONSE   0x00

A relevant response command does not exist for this command

Definition at line 141 of file clusters.h.

#define ZCL_RESPONSE_CONTROLLED_BY_PAYLOAD   0x02

Response reqiurement is controlled by command payload

Definition at line 143 of file clusters.h.

#define ZCL_NETWORK_KEY_CLUSTER_SECURITY   0

Network key enryption is used to secure commands

Definition at line 146 of file clusters.h.

#define ZCL_APPLICATION_LINK_KEY_CLUSTER_SECURITY   1

Encryption with link keys is used to secure commands
